title: Pixel 4 auto-brightness doesn't respond to outside sun/daylight exposure
content:
Indoor, my Pixel's brightness level is at around 30%. But when I go outside in bright sunlight, this is insufficient and my phone's brightness isn't automatically adjusted. I have to manually adjust it - but it is very difficult because it is impossible to see anything as the screen acts like a mirror in the sunlight.

Once I do increase the brightness - by going indoor somewhere - I can see the screen outside. However, I wouldn't call this a fix.

At the time of this post, my Pixel has the following options under "Display" settings:
Brightness level: 29%
Dark theme: On and never turn off automatically
Night light: Off and will never turn on automatically
Adaptive brightness: On
Screen timeout: 30 seconds
Screen attention: Off
Auto-rotate: On
Colors: Adaptive
Ambient EQ: On
Smooth Display: On
Increase touch sensitivity: Off

If you need more setting info, please let me know.
